full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 119 of 247 247 LBUCmax3 Visoski - cross 1 A. Yes. 2 Q. Did you ever mention this to Ghislaine that Epstein was paying for your daughters' tuitions? 3 A. Yes. 4 Q. So she was aware of this fact, too? 5 A. Absolutely. 6 Q. Did you ask Epstein to pay for your daughters' tuitions? 7 A. He offered it when I first got hired. He said that he would take care of all employees' children's education. So we knew it was pretty much a given. 8 Q. So he offered to do this for all of the employees that you're aware of? 9 A. Yes, correct. 10 Q. You didn't have to ask him for it? 11 A. No. 12 Q. So fair to say that Epstein took an interest in seeing your young daughter succeed; isn't that right? 13 A. That's correct. He believed in higher education. 14 Q. And this was when they were high school aged and college aged; isn't that right? 15 A. Yes, and even younger, grade school. 16 Q. You didn't think there was anything inappropriate about that; right? 17 A. No. 18 Q. It was just a generous act on his part, wasn't it? 19 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00011891

additional_notes: The document appears to be a court transcript with a clear Q&A format. The content discusses Jeffrey Epstein's financial support for employees' children's education. There are no visible redactions or damage.
